so with this implementation you would have something like: lstm_skip(128) >>= linear(128, 128) >>= lstm_skip(128). this really should be lstm_skip(128) >>= linear(128, 512) >>= lstm_skip(128) in order to be able to get the same results as normal stacked lstms. looking deeper, the first version would be equivalent to... 
let E = [eye(128), eye(128), eye(128), eye(128)] in
LSTM(E * W * LSTM(E * x)).

Whereas with the raw multilayer cudnn implementation it would be LSTM(W * LSTM(E * x)), which is still wrong, but less wrong.
